SEARCH
Package emissary.config

Class ServiceConfigGuide

java.lang.Object
emissary.config.ServiceConfigGuide
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configurator, Serializable
public class ServiceConfigGuide extends Object implements Configurator, Serializable
This class implements the Configurator interface for services within the Emissary framework.
See Also:

    • handleNewEntry

      protected ConfigEntry handleNewEntry(String parmNameArg, String svalArg, String operatorArg, String filename, int lineno, boolean merge) throws IOException
      Handle a newly parsed or passed in entry. Substitutions are handled on both the LHS and RHS, then the values are stored as a ConfigEntry in our local list and map. Only the last value in the map is available for substitutions. LHS is analyzed before RHS and in L to R order.
      Parameters:
      parmNameArg - the LHS
      svalArg - the raw RHS
      operatorArg - the equation
      filename - the filename we are parsing for error reporting
      lineno - the line number we are currently reporting the error on
      merge - true when adding in from a merge
      Returns:
      a new config entry with the expanded key and value
      Throws:
      IOException - when the key or value is malformed

    • handleReplacements

      protected String handleReplacements(String svalArg, String filename, int lineno) throws IOException
      Handle all the possible replacements in a string value
      Parameters:
      svalArg - the raw value
      filename - the filename we are parsing for error reporting
      lineno - the line number we are currently reporting the error on
      Returns:
      the expanded value with all legal @{..} values replaced
      Throws:
      IOException - when the value is malformed

    • substUTFChars

      protected String substUTFChars(String s, String filename, int lnum) throws IOException
      Substitute any java unicode character values: \\uxxxx
      Parameters:
      s - the string to process
      filename - the name of the file we are in for error reporting
      lnum - the current line number for error reporting
      Returns:
      string with character values replaced
      Throws:
      IOException

    • substEnvProps

      protected String substEnvProps(String str, String filename, int lnum) throws IOException
      Substitute any referenced env properties with their values. Look for @ENV{'foo'} and replace foo with System.getProperty("foo") or System.getenv("foo") in that order.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to process
      filename - the name of the file we are in for error reporting
      lnum - the current line number for error reporting
      Returns:
      string with env values replaced
      Throws:
      IOException

      protected List<ConfigEntry> getRemoveEntries()
      Remove entries, those with operators of '!=' are stored and can be retrieved for replay during merge. This method is not part of the Configurator interface.

    • findStringMatchMap

      public Map<String,String> findStringMatchMap(String theParameter)
      Find entries beginning with the specified string and return a hash keyed on the remainder of the string with the value of the config line as the value of the hash
      Specified by:
      findStringMatchMap in interface Configurator
      Parameters:
      theParameter - the key to look for in the config file
      Returns:
      map with remaining key portion as key, value as value

    • findStringMatchMap

      public Map<String,String> findStringMatchMap(String theParameter, boolean preserveCase)
      Find entries beginning with the specified string and return a hash keyed on the remainder of the string with the value of the config line as the value of the hash 
       
 Example config entries
    FOO_ONE: AAA
    FOO_TWO: BBB
 Calling findStringMatchMap("FOO_",true)
 will yield a map with
     ONE -> AAA
     TWO -> BBB
      Specified by:
      findStringMatchMap in interface Configurator
      Parameters:
      theParameter - the key to look for in the config file
      preserveCase - if false all keys will be upcased
      Returns:
      map where key is remainder after match and value is the config value, or an empty map if none found

    • findStringMatchMap

      public Map<String,String> findStringMatchMap(@Nullable String theParameter, boolean preserveCase, boolean preserveOrder)
      Find entries beginning with the specified string and return a hash keyed on the remainder of the string with the value of the config line as the value of the hash 
       
 Example config entries
    FOO_ONE: AAA
    FOO_TWO: BBB
 Calling findStringMatchMap("FOO_",true)
 will yield a map with
     ONE -> AAA
     TWO -> BBB
      Specified by:
      findStringMatchMap in interface Configurator
      Parameters:
      theParameter - the key to look for in the config file
      preserveCase - if false all keys will be upcased
      preserveOrder - if true key ordering is preserved
      Returns:
      map where key is remainder after match and value is the config value, or an empty map if none found

    • findStringMatchMultiMap

      public Map<String,Set<String>> findStringMatchMultiMap(@Nullable String param)
      Find entries beginning with the specified string and return a hash keyed on the remainder of the string with the value of the config line as the value of the hash Multiple values for the same hash are allowed and returned as a Set. 
       
 Example config entries
    FOO_ONE: AAA
    FOO_TWO: BBB
    FOO_TWO: CCC
 Calling findStringMatchMap("FOO_",true)
 will yield a map with Sets
     ONE -> {AAA}
     TWO -> {BBB,CCC}
      Specified by:
      findStringMatchMultiMap in interface Configurator
      Parameters:
      param - the key to look for in the config file
      Returns:
      map where key is remainder after match and value is a Set of all found config values, or an empty map if none found

    • findSizeEntry

      public long findSizeEntry(String theParameter, long dflt)
      Return a long from a string entry representing either an int, a long, a double, with or without a final letter designation such as "m" or "M" for megabytes, "g" or "G" for gigabytes, etc. Legal designations are bBkKmMgGTt or just a number.
      Specified by:
      findSizeEntry in interface Configurator
      Parameters:
      theParameter - the config entry name
      dflt - the default value when nothing found in config
      Returns:
      the long value of the size parameter

    • debug

      public boolean debug()

    • merge

      public void merge(Configurator other) throws IOException
      Merge in a new configuration set with this one. New things are supposed to override older things in the sense of findStringEntry which only picks the top of the list, the new things should get added to the top. If the merged in Configurator contains remove entries (operator of '!=') then it only applies to entries in this instance, not in "other". This is slightly different than when a config is read in directly, but without that there would be no way to remove entries from a super-config and continue to supply entries here and still be able to use the wildcard remove (value of '*') The order in the merged config file is important. Any '!= "*"' operations must precede the new value being supplied since normal remove operations take place in each config before the merge.
      Specified by:
      merge in interface Configurator
      Parameters:
      other - the new entries to merge in
      Throws:
      IOException

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Public main used to verify config file construction off-line
